description:
Cloud Computing and Large Scale environments require sometime
applications based on complex and distributed architectures… and this
usually means a huge overhead in the design and confusion out of control
in the code (network wise race conditions, single points of failure and
so on)

Introducing elements like \*MQ and IPC frameworks in this kind of
applications is the only way to reduce the complexity and enable a fluid
design (in other words: mess-under-control)

The talk is focused on describing how to design a distributed
application in different scenarios, using ZeroMQ (a modern broker-less
MQ system) as core framework, with examples and demos.
title: Implementing distributed applications using ZeroMQ, Python and other bad guys...
